examples: Check the oil and water before setting off.
Taking the bit between his teeth he set off across the plain with greater speed than the bones of his anatomy ever gave any promise of.
Every so often, Claire has itchy feet and sets off for a foreign destination.
The tree crashed through the conservatory and set off all the alarms, which joined with the sound of the gale to scare me out of my wits.
One week later, this sandwich set off a virtual confrontation between some of the biggest names in fast food.
words.defineEn: to make something operate, especially by accident
words.defineVi: để làm cho một cái gì đó hoạt động, đặc biệt là một cách tình cờ

examples: The tech company's innovative new product is so far ahead of the curve that competitors will struggle to catch up.
Michael enjoys going out for coffee with his friends from work to catch up and unwind after a long day.
Others are catching up fast.
You're all caught up.
Some countries’ death rates have unfortunately caught up since then, which throws off the observed pattern.
words.defineEn: to go faster and reach someone who is ahead
words.defineVi: để đi nhanh hơn và đạt được một người phía trước

examples: She dressed up her doll in a beautiful pink dress.
She was dressed up like a dog’s dinner.
He dressed up for the job interview to the tee, wearing a suit, tie, and polished shoes.
Nothing but bad blood, dressed up in fancy words.
They feel like a million dollars when they dress up for a special occasion and receive admiring glances.
words.defineEn: to wear formal clothes for a special occasion or event
words.defineVi: mặc quần áo trang trọng cho một dịp đặc biệt hoặc sự kiện

examples: I need to buy new underwear because my old ones are worn out.
I may be getting older, but I still believe that it's better to wear out than to rust out, so I keep myself busy with hobbies and volunteer work.
It wears out your body.
Oh man, I wore out my VHS copy of this!
He does not wear out his welcome among his members.
words.defineEn: to become, or make something become useless and no longer in good condition by long or hard usage
words.defineVi: để trở thành, hoặc làm cho một cái gì đó trở nên vô dụng và không còn trong tình trạng tốt bằng cách sử dụng lâu dài hoặc chăm chỉ

examples: The moments around Gaddafi's death were also caught on camera.
It catches on the sides of your cheek.
- You've caught on.

Didn't catch on, unfortunately.
words.defineEn: to become popular or trendy
words.defineVi: để trở nên phổ biến hoặc hợp thời trang

examples: And from that limited recipe, somehow, cells came about.

Well, Lazarus taxa can come about for lots of different reasons.
The problems come about when you can't stop.
The idea for these ecofriendly mugs first came about in 2009 when Julian was studying product design.
words.defineEn: to happen, especially when it is not expected
words.defineVi: xảy ra, đặc biệt là khi nó không được mong đợi

examples: It seeks to leave out the mumbo jumbo about the terms of the agreement.

Perhaps we'll leave out the window.

words.defineEn: to not mention or include something or someone
words.defineVi: để không đề cập đến hoặc bao gồm một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó

examples: The tall man throws up his arms.
When an ant attacks, the caterpillar basically throws up on it.
I never purposely threw up any food.
I might just throw up.
People are constantly throwing up things to stop you in life.
words.defineEn: to vomit
words.defineVi: nôn

examples: run by Hailey Baldwin’s famous uncle.

- Sanbanze is run by a husband and wife duo, Kenji-san and Miho-san.
words.defineEn: to tell someone about an idea, especially to know their opinion about it
words.defineVi: để nói với ai đó về một ý tưởng, đặc biệt là để biết ý kiến của họ về nó

examples: The motion was passed by 16 votes to 11.
The Bill passed by 164 votes to 107.
Christmas passed by, with no presents or new clothes for me.
And soon you pass by a shallow pond.
By day 41, the Earth has passed by Venus.
words.defineEn: to move or go past
words.defineVi: để di chuyển hoặc đi qua

examples: I'm sorry, can you speak up?
Julie knew better than to speak up when her father was so angry, so she buttoned her lip for the moment.
The shy student was hesitant to speak up in class, but if given half the chance, she had some great ideas to share.

He had a bad experience with a difficult boss at his previous job, and now he's afraid to speak up or assert himself at work - illustrating how the man who has once been bitten by a snake fears every piece of rope.
But subjects in a group of three only spoke up 38% of the time.
words.defineEn: to speak in a louder voice
words.defineVi: nói với giọng to hơn

examples: Terrible pain, might pass out.

Before you pass out.
Did she pass out?

examples: Izdihar volunteers used to give out 9,000 bags a day.
My legs gave out on me.
The men all were going to give out their books.
You gave out!

words.defineVi: để phân phối một cái gì đó trong một nhóm các cá nhân

examples: He counted on his fingers to solve the math problem.
You can count on him to be there in weal and woe.
I can always count on my bosom buddy to be there for me.
You gave your word, and people are counting on you.
We knew we could count on him to come up with the goods.
words.defineEn: to rely on or to put trust in something or someone
words.defineVi: dựa vào hoặc đặt niềm tin vào một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó

examples: He is always protective of her younger brother and looks out for him.
Nobody could ever tell whether Prince Andrew was looking out for number one or whether he really had the interests of the country at heart.
Those who play at bowls must look out for rubbers and be prepared to pivot if necessary.
So look out for the highs.
-Somebody is looking out for me, clearly!
words.defineEn: to take care and be watchful of someone or something and make sure no harm comes to them
words.defineVi: chăm sóc và cảnh giác với ai đó hoặc cái gì đó và đảm bảo rằng không có tổn hại nào đến với họ

examples: But for now, sharpshooters are still hooking up.

They're going to hook up.

words.defineEn: to have a brief sexual relationship with a person
words.defineVi: để có một mối quan hệ tình dục ngắn với một người

examples: The company kicked off the CEO for embezzlement.

She kicked off her sandals and jumped into the pool.
words.defineEn: to start or begin
words.defineVi: để bắt đầu hoặc bắt đầu

examples: We sat around the picnic blanket, passing a bowl of filberts, enjoying their crunchy texture.

The unemployment rate in the manufacturing space was sitting around 2.7 percent.
So, I'm just sitting around.
Your loved ones are all sitting around, reminiscing about your life.
words.defineEn: to spend time doing nothing or nothing productive
words.defineVi: dành thời gian không làm gì hoặc không có gì hiệu quả

examples: The CEO's pride and unwillingness to listen to feedback from his team members ended up costing the company millions of dollars, proving once again that pride comes before a fall.

And then it comes before the court.
'But you should have come before!
words.defineEn: to be of greater importance than someone or something else
words.defineVi: có tầm quan trọng lớn hơn ai đó hoặc cái gì khác

examples: Everything was smiles and sunshine in his family, unless you made the mistake of ever going against his wishes.
The decision not to have children somehow goes against the grain.
The idea of taking credit for someone else's work didn't sit right with me because it goes against my values.
I really went against the stream when I was in college with some radical opinions, but as I've grown older I have found myself falling more in line with other people's way of thinking.

words.defineVi: để chống lại hoặc phản đối một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: Her life, the lives of her fellow Vestals, and the safety of Rome itself depends upon it.

And strong government at the end of the day depends upon confidence in government.
Election outcomes can depend upon turnout in these key places.
They depend upon our presence.
words.defineEn: to be decided or affected by something else
words.defineVi: được quyết định hoặc bị ảnh hưởng bởi một cái gì đó khác

examples: Carrageenan is a food additive derived from seaweed that is used as a thickener and stabilizer in dairy products and other foods.
It derived from boogaloo, struttin', poppin', lockin'.

And so the common name here is actually derived from acetone.
Do our rights derive from nature or from God or from neither?
words.defineEn: to be originated from something
words.defineVi: được bắt nguồn từ một cái gì đó

examples: My aunt walks all over my uncle because he's just too meek to stand up for himself.

I know it can be difficult, but you've got to have the guts to stand up for your beliefs!
Stand up for a minute!
But they stand up for themselves.
words.defineEn: to defend or support someone or something
words.defineVi: để bảo vệ hoặc hỗ trợ một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

words.defineEn: to do something in order to replace something lost or fix something damaged
words.defineVi: để làm một cái gì đó để thay thế một cái gì đó bị mất hoặc sửa chữa một cái gì đó bị hư hỏng
